sn39:1-15.0.1_0: The Linked Discourses on the going forth,
sn39:1-15.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying in the land of the Vajjis near Ukkacelā on the bank of the Ganges river.
sn39:1-15.1.2_0: Then the wanderer Sāmaṇḍaka went up to Venerable Sāriputta,
sn39:1-15.1.3_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side.
sn39:1-15.2.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘extinguishment’.
sn39:1-15.2.3_0: “The ending of greed, hate, and delusion.
sn39:1-15.2.5_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for realizing this extinguishment?”
sn39:1-15.3.2_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn39:1-15.3.3_0: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
sn39:1-15.3.4_0: This is the path, the practice, for realizing this extinguishment.”
sn39:1-15.3.5_0: “Reverend, this is a fine path, a fine practice, for realizing this extinguishment.
sn39:1-15.3.6_0: Just this much is enough to be diligent.”
sn39:1-15.3.7_0: First the first part of the body.
sn39:1-15.4.1_0: (These should be expanded in the same way as the Linked Discourses with Jambukhādaka.)

sn39:16.0.3_0: From the banks of the Uruvelakappa
sn39:16.1.11_0: The Linked Discourses with Sāmaṇḍaka are complete.
sn39:16.1.2_0: “Since this teaching and training is suffering.”
sn39:16.1.6_0: “Reverend delight, someone practicing in line with the teaching you practice.”
sn39:16.1.7_0: “But how long is a mendicant practicing in line with the teaching?”
